meanings.definition: To move up and down quickly and lightly
meanings.sent1: The cork bobbed on the water.
meanings.sent2: The buoy bobbed in the waves.
meanings.sent3: The balloon bobbed playfully in the air.
meanings.sent4: The dandelion seeds bobbed in the breeze like tiny dancers.
meanings.sent5: Her ponytail bobbed as she skipped along the path.

meanings.definition: To cut short, as in hair
meanings.sent1: She bobbed her hair for a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: He prefers his hair bobbed above his shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally bobbed the hair too short.
meanings.sent4: The hairstylist expertly bobbed her client's hair into a chic style.
meanings.sent5: After the haircut, her hair bobbed freely around her face.

meanings.sent1: The bird's bobbed caught the attention of the cat.
meanings.sent2: The sudden bobbed of the squirrel startled me.
meanings.sent3: The bobbed of the puppy chasing its tail was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The bobbed of the fish in the water was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The bobbed of the dancer's head added energy to the performance.
